column4: Hello. I want to make a fresh install on a Raid/LVM system. Can I create two partitions on /dev/md0 (one for ext3 /boot, one as PV for LVM) or do I need to create two Raid devices (/dev/md0 for /boot and /dev/md1 as PV for LVM)?
ive never set up software raid, only proper raid with a card
open k3b again and then file -> open the iso
The image file doesn't appear in the file open dialog. Which extension does k3b expect?
iso
or you can right click the iso and select open with k3b
It's not an ISO image. It's a clone copy of an audio cd.
When trying to open it, k3b says "unable to open file" after several minutes of reading (the 600 MB file)
http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-newbie-8/how-do-i-burn-iso-with-k3b-154361/
Yes, I know. But it is not an ISO file.
what sort of file is it?
It's a "clone copy" image k3b made from an _audio_ cd.
what does file /path/to/data say?
data
useful, id delete it and create an iso of the cd, then you can burn that dead easy
You can't create an iso image of an audio cd, can you?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=657648
why would you not be able to, its 1s and 0s like a data cd?
Yes, but I thought it's not ISO9660 formatted ....
as long as it works its ok
if you just wanna copy a cd you can choose that in k3b and it will realise you only have 1 drive and ask you to put a blank cd in
devede can mak dvd iso, you could then extract the vob files from it
I need it the other way round: I already have vob files and want to create an mpeg2 file (without recoding).
do you have audio_ts and video_ts folders?
Yes.
then k3b will accept those if you dont mind qt libs as well as gtk on your system
i dont know what gnome app does it as i dont use it
I don't use gnome. Isn't there a plain cmd line tool to convert vob to mpg files?
mencoder / ffmpeg perhaps
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1255058
Thank you. I've read the posting you pointed to but I couldn't find any relation to my problem. What do you mean?
just saw a success story based on your error
hmmm, did you paste the right URL? My error isn't even menrioned there
theres a few hits for the error you posted
if you then need to use the cd for a live environment for troubleshooting
the alternate install is faster as it doesnt have to boot an x server first
Ok, thank you.
He's using mdadm raid which your _kernel_ should support.
if i bough a new hdd it'd cost more than any of my systems are worth
I didn't understand your statement regarding a new hdd. How'S that related to using RAID?
well i'd need a new hdd to use raid, considering all my systems are 7+ years old its not worth it as they are due to die soon
I mainly use RAID to be able to continue work even when one of my drives fails.
i have a backup every 6 hours so if any do i dont care
But when a dirve fails, you have to shutdown and restore first. But that may depend on your needs.
when they do fail i'll just find someone else who has an "old" pc to sell for 30 quid and i gots a new rig :)
Thank you, but I asked for the CD image download URL. What do I have to search for on http://www.ubuntu.com/desktop/get-ubuntu/download ?
take your pick: http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/releases/   grab lucid or maverick and you'll be fine
Thank you
These seem to be DVD images
http://releases.ubuntu.com/10.10/
remember to MD5 test the ISO before use, so you know it's god
Thank you!
Is there a chance for anyone not knowing the "releases.ubuntu.com" link?
i believe its a setting in ccsm
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1512876
Thank you.
It says it's solved in 10.04.1 (/etc/issue says Ubuntu 10.04.2 LTS here). Any idea what else to do?
sql loves 64bit
LOL 'friend'
http://linux.about.com/od/ubuntu_doc/a/ubudg19t9.htm
Thank you. I can’t find any option in my language that matches „Group Shift/Lock behaviour”. Which entry is it? 10th?
that's  all I know, there is a panel item to switch layouts
http://mygeekopinions.blogspot.com/2011/05/how-to-change-keyboard-layout-in-ubuntu.html
Ok, found it and changed it to "Alt+Shift" because the default "both Alt keys" didn’t work. Thanks for your help.
np bro
http://ubuntugenius.wordpress.com/2010/05/14/how-to-show-text-entry-address-bar-or-breadcrumbs-navigation-buttons-in-nautilus-after-ubuntu-10-04-upgrade/
try CTRL+L
ravedog: Yes, ctrl+l works. Thank you.
no worries
what browsers have you tried?
Only Firefox so far.
It’s the same with chrome (as far as I can hear), so I assume it’s a Youtube problem.
Can you give an example, please?
like RAM drive?
What else could I mean?
just clarifying, so as to not waste time going down the wrong avenue...
a simple 'yes' is sufficient.

if you add:    none /var/ramdisk tmpfs mode=1777,size=500M 0 0     to your /etc/fstab and make the directory /var/ramdisk you will have 500Mb of RAM disk to use (this is volatile storage so will be lost on reboot etc)
I use that for my browser cache :)
With a simple "yes" I couldn't have expressed my actual question: What else is there in Ubuntu/Linux that is a block device in RAM?
well, ram itself is a block device
Thank you. If I add this line to fstab, where's my block device then?
the storage can be accessed from /var/ramdisk and will be 500Mb in size
It looks like a file system. I need a block device.
so, like a sub-block device within the block device of the ram?
Yes, a "separate", size limited block device in RAM.
Like a partition or an LV for other block devices.
can you see why I asked if you wanted a ramdisk now?
No, I still don't know. When I need a "RAM drive", implies this a file system for you?
yes, its a storage drive, in RAM...
Ok. For me it's just a drive (empty). And is there a way to create a size limited block device in RAM without an losetup'd file in a tmpfs?
